snippet: Two Israeli police officers were slightly injured during a clash at a holy site in Jerusalem that erupted during a demonstration after Friday Prayer.
abstract: Two Israeli police officers are slightly injured during protest in Jerusalem at holy site, fiercely contested by both Muslims and Jews, that erupted during a demonstration after Friday Prayer; compound has been operated by Muslim group since Israel captured East Jerusalem during the 1967 war; Jews are allowed to visit site, but not pray there.

byline.contributor: Khaled Abu Aker and Isabel Kershner contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Two Israeli police officers were slightly injured during a clash at a holy site in Jerusalem that erupted during a demonstration after Friday Prayer.

headline.main: New Clashes at Site in Jerusalem Holy to Both Muslims and Jews
headline.print_headline: New Clashes at Site in Jerusalem Holy to Both Muslims and Jews
